1.q_string:
For the non-stoichiometric reaction, \(2 \mathrm{~A}+\mathrm{B} \rightarrow \mathrm{C}+\mathrm{D}\), the following kinetic data were obtained in three separate experiments, all at \(298 \mathrm{~K}\).

Initial Concentration \((\mathrm A)\)Initial Concentration \((\mathrm B)\)Initial Rate of Formation of \(\mathrm{C (mol ~L^{-1}S^{-1}})\)
\(0.1 \mathrm M\)\(0.1 \mathrm M\)\(1.2 \times 10^{-3}\)
\(0.1 \mathrm M\)\(0.2 \mathrm M\)\(1.2 \times 10^{-3}\)
\(0.2 \mathrm M\)\(0.1 \mathrm M\)\(2.4 \times 10^{-3}\)
The rate law for the formation of \(\mathrm C\) is:

q_option: Rate of the reaction depends on concentration of ammonia.
Rate of decomposition of ammonia will remain constant until ammonia disappears completely.
1.q_string:
At high pressure, the following reaction is zero order.

\(2 \mathrm{NH}_{3}(\mathrm{~g}) \frac{1130 \mathrm{k}}{\text { Platinum Catalyst }} \mathrm{N}_{2}(\mathrm{~g})+3 \mathrm{H}_{2}(\mathrm{~g})\)

Which of the following options are correct for this reaction?

In the reaction \(2 \mathrm{~N}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{5} \rightarrow 4 \mathrm{NO}_{2}+\mathrm{O}_{2}\), \(\mathrm{NO}_{2}\) is being formed at the rate of \(0.0072 \mathrm{~mol} \mathrm{~L}^{-1} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\).

If the reaction follows second order kinetics, what is the rate of the reaction when the concentration of \(\mathrm{N}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{5}\) is douled?
A first order reaction is \(20 \%\) complete in \(10 \mathrm{~min}\). The specific rate constant is:
If the unit of the Arrhenius constant for a chemical reaction is \(\mathrm{mol{~L }^{-1} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}}\), then the order of the reaction will be:

q_option: The order of a reaction can be a fractional number
Order of a reaction is experimentally determined quantity
The order of a reaction is always equal to the sum of the stoichiometric coefficients of reactants in the balanced chemical equation for a reaction
The order of a reaction is the sum of the powers of molar concentration of the reactants in the rate law expression.
1.q_string: Which of the following statements is not correct about order of a reaction?

In a first order reaction, the concentration of reactant is reduced to \(\frac{1}{8}\) of the initial concentration in \(75\) minutes at \(298 \mathrm{~K}\). What is the half-life period of the reaction in minutes?
The half-life period of a radioactive element is \(140\) days. After \(560\) days, \(1 \mathrm{~g}\) of the element will be reduced to:
If temperature increase, viscosity of the gases ______ and the viscosity of liquids _______.
A reaction proceeds \(5\) times more at \(60^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) as it does at \(30^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\). What will be the energy of activation? (Given: \((\log 5=0.69990)\)\)
What will be the total pressure after \(200\) seconds, if the initial pressure is \(0.1 \mathrm{~atm}\)?

For the equilibrium, \(A(\mathrm{~g) \rightleftharpoons \ B(g)}, \Delta \mathrm{H}\) is \(-40 \mathrm{~kJ} / \mathrm{mol}\). If the ratio of the activation energies of the forward \( \left(\mathrm{E_{f}}\right)\) and reverse \((\mathrm{E_{b}})\) reactions is \(\frac{2}{3}\) then:

The rate of a reaction doubles when its temperature changes from \(300 \mathrm{~K}\) to \(310 \mathrm{~K}\). Activation energy of such a reaction will be: 

(Given: \(\mathrm{R=8.314 ~KJmol^{-1}}\) and \(\left.\log 2=0.301\right)\)

q_option: Half the rate that \(\mathrm B\) will decrease
The same rate as \(\mathrm A\) will decrease
Twice the rate as \(\mathrm B\) will decrease
1.q_string: In the elementary reaction, \(2 \mathrm{~A}+\mathrm{B} \rightarrow \mathrm{A}_{2} \mathrm{~B}\), the reactant \(\mathrm{A}\) will disappear at:

q_option: Both statements are true Statement (II) is correct explanation of Statement (I)
Both statements are true but Statement (II) is not correct explanation of Statement (I)
Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false
Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true
1.q_string:
Statement - I: Every collision of reactant molecule is not successful.

Statement - II: Every collision of reactant molecule with proper orientation is successful one.

1.1: Direction: There are given two statements, statements (I) and statements(II). Read them and answer the given question.
